response.overview: Dwight and Chad -- two train-hopping, homeless, musicians -- are wanting to slow down their nomadic ways. Though only 28 and 27 years old respectively, they've been living as hobos since they dropped out of college. They're stuck in a cycle of bouncing from city to city on trains, sleeping in the woods, digging through trash cans, and playing music for alcohol money. The documentary portrays their struggles to find a life for themselves on the road, while chasing their musical dreams and the eventual goal of slowing down and finding a home.
response.title: No Tracks Home
